meanings.sent1: The cat slipped through the door without making a sound.
meanings.sent2: She slipped into the room unnoticed.
meanings.sent3: The ninja slipped past the guards like a shadow.
meanings.sent4: Time slipped away as they enjoyed the peaceful evening.
meanings.sent5: The boat slipped gracefully across the calm water.

meanings.definition: To lose one's footing and slide unintentionally
meanings.sent1: He slipped on the wet floor and fell down.
meanings.sent2: The child slipped on the ice and landed on the ground.
meanings.sent3: She slipped on a banana peel, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent4: The car slipped on the icy road, spinning out of control.
meanings.sent5: The hiker slipped on the loose rocks, but quickly regained balance.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error
meanings.sent1: I slipped up and forgot to send the important email.
meanings.sent2: He slipped and used the wrong formula in the math problem.
meanings.sent3: She slipped and accidentally deleted the entire document.
meanings.sent4: The comedian slipped and told the wrong joke at the party.
meanings.sent5: They slipped in their presentation and missed a key point.

meanings.definition: To pass or go quickly or easily
meanings.sent1: The key slipped into the lock effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle pieces slipped together perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The plan slipped into place without any issues.
meanings.sent4: The words slipped off his tongue smoothly during the speech.
meanings.sent5: The gears slipped into position with a satisfying click.

meanings.sent1: The spy slipped away before anyone noticed.
meanings.sent2: The thief slipped out of the building without being seen.
meanings.sent3: The ghost slipped through the walls, unseen by the living.
meanings.sent4: The shadow slipped into the darkness, disappearing from sight.
meanings.sent5: The fugitive slipped past the police and vanished into the night.
